result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer Ann Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jennifer Ann Clark is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jennifer Ann Clark was found guilty of Forgery-Writings or Objects [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jennifer Ann Clark appeared from jail. Case called at 1:20 p.m. Court notes these matters are set for sentencing hearing. Both parties have received copies of PSI. No corrections noted. ADA McKinley gives sentencing arguments and recommendations. State is in compliance with Victim notification laws. Royal Credit Union is requesting restitution in the amount of $2,875.00. Atty Harrelson gives sentencing arguments and recommendations. Requesting court follow recommendations of PSI. DE makes statement. All bond money posted will apply to to fines and restitution. 20 days to file appeal.

- S/W 5 years probation. Run concurrent to all other counts and files
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
- Court costs of $268.00. Bond to apply. Remaining amount to be paid to DOC over the course of probation.
- DNA Sample and $250.00 Surcharge
- Restitution in the amount of $2,875.00 to be paid to Royal Credit Union. To be paid to DOC over the course of probation.

- Apply and if accepted, complete Drug Court

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jennifer Ann Clark appeared from jail. Case called at 10:47 a.m. Atty Harrelson states has been working with ADA McKinley on a global resolution. Offer was extended. Atty Harrelson is not in agreement on the offer. If DE would like to take the offer, will ask for a withdrawal of counsel on those matters. Also would like to be heard on motion for reconsideration filed on 15CF358. ADA McKinley addresses consolidation of matters. Atty Harrelson gives argument. Court gives proposal and will due further scheduling. Will not set a final pre trial on matters unless parties request. Court will set another court date regarding consolidation.  Hearing scheduled for June 12, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF358(MH) and 17CF172 (PH):
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jennifer Ann Clark appeared from jail. Case called at 3:40 p.m. Court notes 15CF358 is set for a motion hearing and 17CF172 is set for a preliminary hearing. Court will address the motion first. Atty Harrelson calls Nicholas R. to the stand. S/T Nicholas R. Direct by Atty Harrelson. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Cross by ADA McKinley. Redirect by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. No further evidence by either party. Argument by Atty Harrelson. Requesting court vacate verdict and DE be given a new trial. ADA McKinley gives argument. Requesting court DENY motion. Rebuttal by Atty Harrelson. Court DENIES motion. Court will hear the motion regarding forfeit of bond at the CFsentencing hearing. Preliminary hearing on 17CF172. State calls Deputy Mark to the stand. S/T Tamara Mark. Employed with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA McKinley. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. No further evidence or argument by the State. Argument by Atty Harrelson. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.
To RMW from R.J. and R.J. to reconsider your decision to forfeit bail. hml

Case called at 8:33 a.m. Court notes main purpose is to hear final pre trial conference on file 15CF374. Motion in Limine filed by both parties. Atty Harrelson gives argument regarding Other Acts/Evidence. ADA McKinley responds. Court will DENY defense's motion. ADA McKinley addresses prior convictions. Court asks parties to discuss prior convictions. If court needs to make a ruling, it will. Atty Harrelson addresses bond. Court will not hear bond argument today, a motion will need to be filed.

Sentencing hearing on May 26, 2017 at 10:00 am.

* AMENDED *

Includes 15CF358,15CF374,15CF473, 16CF26, 16CF98, 16CF107,16CF156, 16CF171,16CF205, 16CF312 and 16CF503

-   Comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement.

-     Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT with ALL SOCIAL MEDIA.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. DE is to deactivate Facebook account.

-   Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

-  DE to be fitted with a GPS Unit at DE's cost

-  DE to be restricted to St Croix County only

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Includes 15CF358 (BBH), 15CF374,15CF473, 16CF26, 16CF98, 16CF107,16CF156, 16CF171,16CF205, 16CF312 and 16CF503 (STC)
  CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jennifer Ann Clark appeared. Case called at 3:38 p.m. 15CF358 is set for a bail bond hearing. Court reviews file. Atty Harrelson states DE tested last evening. This a.m. she went to get GPS arranged but they need a court order. Advises court may file a motion to reopen verdict. DE realized she recognized a juror at the end of the trial. Atty Harrelson found a 97 Felony file. Court directs Atty Harrelson to file motions and will address motions at that time. ADA McKinley requesting DE be remanded to the county jail. Gives argument. Atty Harrelson gives argument. Court will revoke existing bond on all files and make one uniform bond for all files. Court orders PSI. PSI report due May 15, 2017.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2017 at 10:00 am.
#1 - #52 PL and #1003 DE. eif
Opening Instructions. eif
signed by the Jury Foreperson - Guilty of forgery as party to a crime. eif
of Adam Schottle. eif
of service Adam Schottle. eif
of service to E. Ferrill. eif
Bail/bond hearing on March 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jennifer Ann Clark appeared. JURY TRIAL DAY 2. Case called at 9:02 a.m. with the jury present. State recalls Investigator Cary Rose to the stand. S/T Cary Rose. Direct by ADA McKinley. PL Exhibit #37 (supplemental report). PL Exhibit #46 (picture of contents in tin container). Atty Harrelson withdraws objection on Exhibit #37. O/R Exhibit's #37 and #46. PL Exhibit #47 (hand written envelope). O/R Exhibit #47. PL Exhibit #48 (photo of envelope). O/R Exhibit #48. PL Exhibit #49 (photo of envelope). O/R Exhibit #49. PL Exhibit #55(envelope found in garbage). O/R Exhibit #55. PL Exhibit #50 (partial photo of items found in garbage). O/R Exhibit #50. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA McKinley. State calls Investigator Hart to the stand. S/T Brandi Hart. Investigator with St Croix County Sheriff's Dept. Direct by ADA McKinley. Refers to PL Exhibit #2. PL Exhibit #58 (2-Counterfeit $20.00 bills). O/R Exhibit #58. PL Exhibit #56 (). O/R Exhibit #56. SIDE BAR. PL Exhibit #59 (Chevron notebook). O/R Exhibit #59. Refers to Exhibit #55. PL Exhibit #57 (counterfeit $20's). Atty Harrelson has an ongoing objection to photographs. O/R Exhibit #57. PL Exhibit #51 (Supplemental evidence list of items in cardboard box). O/R Exhibit #51. PL Exhibit #53 (green color folder). PL Exhibit #60 (). O/R Exhibit #60. PL Exhibit #54 (contents found in green folder). O/R Exhibit #54. Jury excused at 10:24 a.m. Court will recess. Case recalled at 10:43 a.m. outside the presence of the jury. Court addresses a SIDE BAR. Atty Harrelson addresses discovery issues. Requesting a few minutes to review discovery. ADA McKinley responds. Atty Harrelson addresses witness Brianne S. Court can not rule on abstract but previously ruled drug activity as inadmissible as not pertinent to this forgery case. Atty Harrelson requesting a mistrial due to discovery violation by the State. Requesting clarification from the State. Deputy Fayerweather makes statement. Case recalled and jury present at 10:55 a.m. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Investigator Hart still on the stand under oath. Refers to Exhibit #56. Refers to Exhibit #59. Redirect by ADA McKinley. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. State calls Investigator Fayerweather to the Stand. S/T Dean Fayerweather. Employed as an Investigator with St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA McKinley. Refers to Exhibit #2. PL Exhibit #52 (photograph of box that contained printer and supplies). O/R Exhibit #52. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. SIDE BAR. Refers to Exhibit #2. Cross by Atty Harrelson. SIDE BAR. DE Exhibit #1002b (55 page document). SIDE BAR. Refers to Exhibit #2. SIDE BAR. Jury excused at 12:03 p.m. Court recesses at 12:04 p.m. Case recalled at 12:59 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Court addresses the previous side bar before lunch. Atty Harrelson makes record. Court will sustain the State's objection on relevance. Case recalled at 1:11 p.m. with the jury presence. Investigator Fayerweather retakes the stand, still under oath. Redirect by ADA McKinley. SIDE BAR. Witness excused. State calls Investigator Haefner to the Stand. S/T James Haefner. Employed as Investigator with St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA McKinley. Witness excused. State calls Investigator Mikla to the Stand. S/T James Mikla. Investigator with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA McKinley. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA McKinley. Witness excused. State rests at 1:34 p.m. Jury excused. On the record outside the presence of the jury at 1:35 p.m. Atty Harrelson makes statement regarding questioning. Jury present and case recalled at 1:43 p.m. Atty Harrelson calls Stephen C. to the stand. S/T Stephen C. Direct by Atty Harrelson. Cross by ADA McKinley. Witness excused. Jury excused at 1:52 p.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. Adam S. takes the stand. Called as a defense witness. Court advises witness of his rights to remain silent and not to incriminate self. DE understands. Jury present and case recalled at 2:02 p.m. Adam S. on the stand. S/T Adam S. Direct by Atty Harrelson. SIDE BAR. Cross by ADA McKinley. SIDE BAR. Redirect by Atty Harrelson. Cross by ADA McKinley. Witness excused. Jury excused at 2:46 p.m. Court recesses at 2:46 p.m. Case recalled at 3:04 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Atty Harrelson will be recalling Investigator Haefner. Court reviews rights with DE to remail silent and right to testify. DE understands and will exercise right to remain silent. Ct finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes decision to waive right to testify and will invoke right to remain silent. Case recalled and jury present at 3:10 p.m. Atty Harrelson recalls Investigator Haefner to the stand. Still under oath. Direct by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. Atty Harrelson calls Edie F. to the stand. SIDE BAR. Atty Harrelson and the State have agreed to the facts of the record and will stipulate to the facts. Ms. F. excused. Rebuttal by the State. ADA McKinley calls Investigator Geister to the stand. S/T Chris Geister. Direct by ADA McKinley. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. State calls Investigator Mikla to the stand. Still under oath. Retakes the stand. Direct by ADA McKinley. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. State recalls Investigator Haefner back to the stand. Still under oath. Retakes the stand. Direct by ADA McKinley. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. Evidence is now closed at 3:26 p.m. Jury excused at 3:27 p.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. OFF RECORD. Case recalled at 3:47 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Parties review jury instructions and the Verdicts. Atty Harrelson gives argument. ADA McKinley gives argument. Case recalled and jury present at 4:05 p.m. Jury instructions are given at 4:05 p.m. Closing argument by ADA McKinley at 4:20 p.m. Closing argument by Atty Harrelson at 4:51 p.m. Rebuttal by ADA McKinley at 5:22 p.m. Court reads Verdicts and closing instructions to the jury. Oath to Bailiff given at 5:33 p.m. Jury excused to deliberate at 5:34 p.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. ADA McKinley brings attention to Jury Instruction #2 and #3. Atty Harrelson makes statement. Case recalled at 6:02 p.m. Jury has reached a Verdict:
- We the jury find the DE GUILTY of Forgery as party to the crime
Court polls the Jury. Jury excused at 6:04 p.m. State moves to revoke bond and remand DE into custody. Atty Harrelson gives argument and is requesting a PSI be ordered. Requesting DE be released on bond pending sentencing. State objects. Court will revoke bond and review bond tomorrow. DE needs to find someone for her children. Court orders DE to report to the jail this evening and give a UA sample. If sample is clean, may be released and must reappear tomorrow at 3:30 p.m. If DE has a positive test, must remain in custody.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
to E. Ferrill filed by Atty Jeremiah Harrelson. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jennifer Ann Clark appeared. JURY TRIAL DAY 1. Case called at 8:45 a.m. outside the presence of the jury. Motion received on Friday by defense requesting Motion to Exclude Expert Testimony. Atty Harrelson gives argument. ADA McKinley responds. Court responds. State moving to dismiss Count 5. Atty Harrelson does not object. Court will dismiss Count 5. ADA McKinley addresses a Voir Dire question for the Court. ADA McKinley addresses a Witness. Atty Harrelson responds. Court will revisit collateral information. Atty Harrelson states that the discovery provided by the State was incomplete. Requesting witness to be excluded due to discovery violation. Court will deny request. Atty Harrelson requesting the same on two additional witnesses be excluded due to discovery violation by the State. Gives argument. Court directs State to find out agreements with possible witnesses. Atty Harreslon requesting DE's other pending charges be excluded from testimony. ADA McKinley responds. Case recalled at 9:27 a.m. with the jury present. Jury selection begins at 9:27 a.m. Oath of Jurors as to Qualifications given at 9:28 a.m. Voir dire by the court at 9:29 a.m. Voir Dire by ADA McKinley at 9:58 a.m. Voir Dire by Atty Harrelson at 10:10 a.m. Peremptory strike at 10:21 a.m. Jury selected at 10:30 a.m. Oath of Jurors for Trial given at 10:30 a.m. Jury excused at 10:32 a.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. No objection to Voir Dire by either party. Court recesses at 10:33 a.m. Case recalled and jury present at 10:57 a.m. Court gives opening jury instructions. Opening statement by ADA McKinley at 11:07 a.m. Opening statement by Atty Harrelson at 11:24 a.m. SIDE BAR. Jury excused at 11:32 a.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. Atty Harrelson addresses prior convictions of witness Katie M. Gives argument. ADA McKinley responds. Court will not exclude Katie M. from testifying. Parties will be able to only ask witness number of prior convictions. Case recalled at 11:41 a.m. with the jury present. State calls Katie M. to the stand. S/T Katie M. Direct by ADA McKinley. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record reflects identification. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA McKinley. Recross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. Jury excused at 12:04 p.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. Parties will review evidence and exhibits over the lunch hour. Court recesses at 12:06 p.m. Case recalled at 1:13 p.m. in the presence of the jury. State calls Deputy Krueger. S/T Nick Krueger. Patrol Officer with St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA McKinley. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record reflects identification. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. State calls Chief Yehlik to the Stand. S/T Craig Yehlik. Employed as Chief of Police for the City of New Richmond. Direct by ADA McKinley. PL Exhibit #25 ($50.00 bill). O/R Exhibit #25. Permission to publish granted. PL Exhibit #26 ($20.00 bill). O/R Exhibit #26. Permission to publish granted. PL Exhibit #27 ($20.00 bill). O/R Exhibit #27. PL Exhibit #1 (Evidence Report). PL Exhibit #3 (photograph of bedroom). O/R Exhibit #3. PL Exhibit #28 (bill with face on both sides). O/R Exhibit #28. PL Exhibit #4 (photograph of Exhibit #28). PL Exhibit #5 (photograph of Exhibit #28). O/R Exhibit #4 & #5. PL Exhibit #6 (photo of shelf containing brushes, etc.) O/R Exhibit #6. PL Exhibit #7 (photo of plate). O/R Exhibit #7. PL Exhibit #29 (paper with stain). O/R Exhibit #29. PL Exhibit #8 (face side of $50.00 bill). PL Exhibit #9 (back side of $50.00 bill). O/R Exhibit's #8 & #9. PL Exhibit #30 (multiple items). O/R Exhibit #30. PL Exhibit #11 (photocopy and a bill). O/R Exhibit #11. PL Exhibit #10 (photograph). Exhibit #10. PL Exhibit #13(). O/R Exhibit #13. PL Exhibit #12( photograph). O/R Exhibit #12. PL Exhibit's 14, 15 & 16 (pictures of bill's located between the magazines). O/R Exhibit's #14, #15 & #16. PL Exhibit #17 (multiple $50 bills). O/R Exhibit #17. PL Exhibit #18 (photograph of inside of car). O/R Exhibit #18. PL Exhibit's #21 and #22 (photos of washed bills). O/R Exhibit #21 & #22. PL Exhibit's #19, #20 & #23 (photographs of contents found in wallet). O/R Exhibit's #19, #20 and #23. PL Exhibit #32 (). O/R Exhibit #32. PL Exhibit #33 (). O/R Exhibit #33. PL Exhibit #34 (). O/R Exhibit #34. PL Exhibit #24. O/R Exhibit #24. SIDE BAR. PL Exhibit #35 (supplemental report by Chief Yehlik). Court will recess at 2:38 p.m. Jury excused. Case recalled at 2:58 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Court addresses Atty Harrelson's motion regarding expert testimony. Case recalled with the jury present at 3:00 p.m. Cross by Atty Harrelson. SIDE BAR. DE Exhibit #1003 (FHM Magazine). PL Exhibit #31 (FHM Magazine with various bills). SIDE BAR. Jury excused at 3:13 p.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. State objects to the offering of the magazines. Atty Harrelson offers relevance. Court overrules objection. Atty Harrelson gives argument regarding testimony regarding Cory S. State gives argument. Court will standby ruling and finds not relevant. On the record with the jury present at 3:20 p.m. Continued cross by Atty Harrelson. O/R Exhibit #31. O/R Exhibit #1003. Redirect by ADA McKinley. Witness excused. State calls Investigator Westmoreland to the stand. S/T Andrew Westmoreland. Detective with the New Richmond P.D. Direct by ADA McKinley. PL Exhibit #1 (Evidence report). O/R Exhibit #1. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. State calls Brianne S. to the stand. SIDE BAR. S/T Brianne S. Direct by ADA McKinley. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA McKinley. Witness excused. SIDE BAR. Jury excused at 3:54 p.m. Outside the presence of the jury at 3:55 p.m. ADA McKinley states Exhibit's need to be marked. Court recesses at 3:56 p.m. State calls Investigator Standaert to the stand. S/T Brent Standaert. Investigator with St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA McKinley. PL Exhibit #36 (item found inside microwave). O/R Exhibit #36. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. State calls Investigator Rose to the stand. S/T Cary Rose. Investigator with St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA McKinley. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. PL Exhibit #2 (Evidence Report). PL Exhibit #37 (Itemized supplemental report). SIDE BAR. Court will reserve on Exhibit #37. PL Exhibit #38(paper found in the garbage). O/R Exhibit #38. PL Exhibit #39 (Photograph of copy machine and bills). O/R Exhibit #39. PL Exhibit #40 (photograph of bill found in garbage). O/R Exhibit #40. PL Exhibit #43 (). O/R Exhibit #43. PL Exhibit #41(photographs). O/R Exhibit #41. PL Exhibit #42 (handwritten note in garbage). O/R Exhibit #42. PL Exhibit's #44 and #45 (handwritten notes and pictures found in the garbage). O/R Exhibit's #44 & #45. Court will recess for the day. Jurors to report at 8:30 a.m. tomorrow. Jury excused and witness excused at 4:50 p.m. Court will review Exhibit #37 tomorrow. Court recesses at 4:50 p.m.
